div.p: Bibliothèque des Conservatoire et Jardin botaniques, Geneva.

Allow me, dear and honoured Sir, to send you a letter, received from Prof Goodale,
Letter not found. the celebrated Prof and Director of the bot. Garden of Harvard-University, Boston, and two years ago the President of the American Assoc for Advancement of Science. I send this letter because Prof Goodale refers so touchingly to my eulogy of your lamented father.
B93.06.04. I hope the letter of condolence from the Boys Naturalists Association here to you
See M to C. de Candolle, 13 June 1893. was showing to you in their "eloge" in how wide esteem the memory of your parent is held. You have there even a Society also, which published its "Les feuilles des jeunes Naturalistes", a publication which comes also under my notice here. Although I am since 47 years a British Subject, I am in my tendencies a Cosmopolitan, and this reminds me that — to judge from name — your respected mother was of German origin!
